title: What are the strongest critiques of the 'Black Lives Matter' movement? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Lies. If you are black, the odds of you being shot by a police officer are unbelievably small. You are significantly more likely to be killed by a black criminal. Yet when cops shoot said black criminals, the riots ensue. And if you present said rioters (who the left claim are protesters) with evidence that the criminal they’re rioting over was a criminal, it goes from “Justice for X” to “this ain’t about one man. It’s a movement!”. In other words, the members are convinced they can do no wrong, even if a specific protest is based on a false narrativeThey are violent. They just are. Not blacks. Not all BLM protesters. But after watching the protests here’s how they tend to go. The start of the protest is multi ethnic and multi generational. From young white millennials to black pensioners, local congressmen, students, workers, etc. Then as the night goes on, the crowd transforms to almost exclusively under 30 year old blacks and only blacks. Then the crowd changes from “no justice, no peace” and “black lives matter” to “burn that shit down!” and “yo they beating up all the white people!”.The fact that the protests are blatantly anti police, yet because it comes in the wake of a shooting, you get shut down if you say so. A friend of mine (a black friend) used to be in BLM. Used to go on the protests after killings and call for body cameras and trials…which she still does. But she got scared. Why? Because if you hung around long enough, you’d see the crowd transformation I talked about in point 2. Black youths (usually unemployed) start to show up. They bring switchblades, pocket knives, the makings of a Molotov cocktail and the occasional gun. She didn’t like that. She stuck around for one that saw riot police coming in during the riot to have bricks and such thrown at them, the occasional Molotov being thrown. Cars were being pushed on their side or vandalised, people were breaking into stores and stealing TVs, DVD players, Xboxes (no books obviously). How was this helping anything? This isn’t about racial justice, it’s about opportunism. “Well, those people clearly aren’t true black lives matter supporters” you say. Yeah they are. Don’t fool yourself, they absolutely are. They showed up for the protest but stuck around and looked to make a buck from the problems.Black Lives Matter attacking white people. Now, if I recall this particular “protest” as liberals call it was started after a black police officer shot a black armed suspect as he pointed his gun at the officer. This is not a rarity for a BLM “protest”. Chief Flynn after Nov. 6 police commission meeting This is a sane person providing a pretty good analysis of the whole “black injustice” thing. I don’t have the stats here but if I recall the breakdown of black killing victims are something like 90% blacks killed by blacks, 6% blacks killed by cops and 4% by whites, but I’m sure I’m off there. That’s a rough breakdown of it. What I want to know is how a group that calls itself Black Lives Matter has chosen to focus on the 6% of black shooting victims of police rather than the 90% of blacks shot by other blacks. It seems to me that if black lives mattered, surely 90 black lives are more important than 6. This is not to say you should ignore those 6, but at least include the other 90! When asked, BLM give some weak response like “oh we’ve protested inner city crime before”. Yet they protest the people whose job it is to stop inner city crime. It’s a messed up organisation/movement and this is without touching on the whole socialist policies their leaders advocate for
